{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child's symptoms of chronic fatigue, abdominal distension with a positive fluid wave, and lower extremity edema are suggestive of protein malnutrition, also known as kwashiorkor. This condition is often seen in children from developing countries and is characterized by inadequate protein intake despite sufficient caloric intake. This leads to hypoalbuminemia, which causes a decrease in plasma oncotic pressure and results in the extravasation of fluid into the interstitial space, causing edema.", "answer_choice": "B. Relative protein intake"}
